description: Ticket numbers, customer portals & robo-emails aren't a great way to build trust. Help Scout makes every customer interaction a personalized one.
steps: Click the `person` icon on the top right of your account, next to the search, then click Your Profile.
Click the Authentication link in the menu on the left, followed by the API Keys tab.
You can generate as many help desk API keys as necessary and label them.

events.name: webhookEvent
steps: Navigate to https://www.helpscout.net to get your API key
Navigate to https://rapidapi.com/package/HelpDesk/functions/createWebhook to create a webhook using your apiKey, and the url:

args.name: secret
args.info: A randomly-generated (by you) string of 40 characters.

blocks.name: getMailboxConversations
blocks.description: Return conversations in a mailbox.

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Returns conversations that have been modified since the given date/time.

args.name: tags
args.info: Returns conversations that have been tagged with any of the specified tags.

blocks.name: getFolderMailboxConversations
blocks.description: Return conversations in a specific folder of a mailbox.

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Returns conversations that have been modified since the given date/time.

args.name: tags
args.info: Returns conversations that have been tagged with any of the specified tags.

blocks.name: getCustomerMailboxConversations
blocks.description: Return conversations for a specific customer in a mailbox.

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Returns conversations that have been modified since the given date/time.

args.name: tags
args.info: Returns conversations that have been tagged with any of the specified tags.

blocks.name: getUserMailboxConversations
blocks.description: Return conversations assigned to a specific user in a mailbox.

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Returns conversations that have been modified since the given date/time.

args.name: tags
args.info: Returns conversations that have been tagged with any of the specified tags.

blocks.name: getSingleConversation
blocks.description: Return a single conversation.

blocks.name: getAttachmentData
blocks.description: Return attachment data object.

blocks.name: createConversation
blocks.description: Create conversation object

args.name: imported
args.info: The 'imported' request parameter enables conversations to be created for historical purposes (i.e. if moving from a different platform, you can import your history). When 'imported' is set to true, no outgoing emails or notifications will be generated.

args.name: autoReply
args.info: The 'autoReply' request parameter enables auto replies to be sent when a conversation is created via the API. When 'autoReply' is set to true, an auto reply will be sent as long as there is at least one 'customer' thread in the conversation.

args.name: reload
args.info: Set this request parameter to true to return the created conversation in the response.

blocks.name: updateConversation
blocks.description: Update conversation object

args.name: reload
args.info: Set this request parameter to true to return the created conversation in the response.

blocks.name: createConversationThread
blocks.description: Create conversation thread

args.name: imported
args.info: The 'imported' request parameter enables conversations to be created for historical purposes (i.e. if moving from a different platform, you can import your history). When 'imported' is set to true, no outgoing emails or notifications will be generated.

args.name: reload
args.info: Set this request parameter to true to return the created conversation in the response.

blocks.name: updateConversationThread
blocks.description: Update conversation thread

args.name: reload
args.info: Set this request parameter to true to return the created conversation in the response.

blocks.name: deleteConversation
blocks.description: Delete conversation

blocks.name: deleteNote
blocks.description: Delete note

blocks.name: createAttachment
blocks.description: Create Attachment

blocks.name: deleteAttachment
blocks.description: Delete attachment

blocks.name: getCustomersList
blocks.description: Return list of mailbox customers. Customers can be filtered on any combination of first name, last name, email, and modifiedSince.

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Returns customers that have been modified since the given date/time.

blocks.name: getMailboxCustomers
blocks.description: Returns a list of Customers with conversations associated with the specified mailbox.

blocks.name: getSingleCustomer
blocks.description: Returns a single customer object

blocks.name: createCustomer
blocks.description: Create customer

args.name: emails
args.info: At least one email address is required.

args.name: reload
args.info: Set this request parameter to true to return the customer in the response.

blocks.name: updateCustomer
blocks.description: Update customer. When updating a customer, you can either pass the entire customer, or pass only the fields that need to be updated.

args.name: emails
args.info: At least one email address is required.

args.name: reload
args.info: Set this request parameter to true to return the customer in the response.

blocks.name: getMailboxList
blocks.description: Return mailbox list.

blocks.name: getSingleMailbox
blocks.description: Returns a mailbox object.

blocks.name: getMailboxFolders
blocks.description: Returns a mailbox folders.

blocks.name: getConversationsReport
blocks.description: The conversations report provides statistics about conversation volume over a given time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how conversation volume changed between the two ranges.

blocks.name: getBusiestDayTimeReport
blocks.description: The busiest time of day report provides a summary of which days and times had the highest coversation volume. Days/hours are reported using the company's time zone.

blocks.name: getNewConversationsReport
blocks.description: The new conversations report provides a summary of new conversation volume over a given time range.

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day,week,month

blocks.name: getReceivedMessagesReport
blocks.description: The received messages report provides a summary of he volume of received messages over a given time range. Only messages from customers are counted.

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day,week,month

blocks.name: getDrillDownReport
blocks.description: This report is similar to the Conversations Report, but instead of returning statistics about conversation volume, it drills down and returns the conversation data that makes up the Conversations Report.

args.name: rows
args.info: Number of results to return per page; defaults to 10; maximum is 50

blocks.name: getFieldDrillDownReport
blocks.description: This report is similar to the Conversations Report, but instead of returning statistics about conversation volume, it drills down and returns the conversation data (by conversation field) that makes up the Conversations Report.

args.name: field
args.info: The identifier on which to drill down; can be an identifier representing a tag, saved reply, workflow, or customer

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The identifier on which to drill down; can be an identifier representing a tag, saved reply, workflow, or customer

args.name: rows
args.info: Number of results to return per page; defaults to 10; maximum is 50

blocks.name: getNewDrillDownReport
blocks.description: This report is similar to the New Conversations Report, but instead of returning statistics about new conversation volume, it drills down and returns the actual new conversations that makes up the New Conversations Report.

args.name: rows
args.info: Number of results to return per page; defaults to 10; maximum is 50

blocks.name: getDocsReport
blocks.description: The Docs report provides statistics about Docs usage (searches, top articles, etc.) over a given time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how usage changed between the two ranges.

blocks.name: getHappinessOverallReport
blocks.description: The happiness report provides information about how many Great, Okay, and Not Good ratings your company received for each period in a specified time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how happiness ratings changed between the two time ranges.

blocks.name: getHappinessRatingsReport
blocks.description: The happiness ratings report provides a company's ratings for over a specified time range.

args.name: rating
args.info: Which set of ratings to display. Must be: 0 - for all ratings, 1 - for Great ratings, 2 - for Okay ratings, 3 - for Not Good ratings

args.name: sortField
args.info: Field which to sort results by. Must be: number, modifiedAt, rating

blocks.name: getProductivityOverallReport
blocks.description: The productivity report provides a snapshot of productivity over a given time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how productivity changed between the two ranges.

args.name: officeHours
args.info: Whether to take office hours into consideration in the report (defaults to 0); office hours must be enabled if 1 is passed, otherwise the default of 0 will be used

blocks.name: getFirstResponseTimeReport
blocks.description: This report provides average first response times for each period in a specified time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how first response time changed between the two ranges.

args.name: officeHours
args.info: Whether to take office hours into consideration in the report (defaults to 0); office hours must be enabled if 1 is passed, otherwise the default of 0 will be used

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Represents the resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day - only allowed if time range is <= 120 days, week - only allowed if time range is <= 1 year, month - only allowed if time range is >= 61 days

blocks.name: getRepliesSentReport
blocks.description: This report provides the number of replies sent for each period in a specified time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how the number of replies sent changed between the two ranges.

args.name: officeHours
args.info: Whether to take office hours into consideration in the report (defaults to 0); office hours must be enabled if 1 is passed, otherwise the default of 0 will be used

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Represents the resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day - only allowed if time range is <= 120 days, week - only allowed if time range is <= 1 year, month - only allowed if time range is >= 61 days

blocks.name: getResolvedReport
blocks.description: This report provides the number of resolved conversations for each period in a specified time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how the number of resolved conversations changed between the two ranges.

args.name: officeHours
args.info: Whether to take office hours into consideration in the report (defaults to 0); office hours must be enabled if 1 is passed, otherwise the default of 0 will be used

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Represents the resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day - only allowed if time range is <= 120 days, week - only allowed if time range is <= 1 year, month - only allowed if time range is >= 61 days

blocks.name: getResolutionTimeReport
blocks.description: A variety of filters are available as query parameters. Including any of these will result in only conversations that match the filters being included in the report.

args.name: officeHours
args.info: Whether to take office hours into consideration in the report (defaults to 0); office hours must be enabled if 1 is passed, otherwise the default of 0 will be used

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Represents the resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day - only allowed if time range is <= 120 days, week - only allowed if time range is <= 1 year, month - only allowed if time range is >= 61 days

blocks.name: getResponseTimeReport
blocks.description: This report provides average response times for each period in a specified time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how response time changed between the two ranges.

args.name: officeHours
args.info: Whether to take office hours into consideration in the report (defaults to 0); office hours must be enabled if 1 is passed, otherwise the default of 0 will be used

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Represents the resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day - only allowed if time range is <= 120 days, week - only allowed if time range is <= 1 year, month - only allowed if time range is >= 61 days

blocks.name: getProductivityDrillDownReport
blocks.description: This report is similar to the Productivity Report, but instead of returning statistics about productivity, it drills down and returns the conversation data that makes up the Productivity Report.

args.name: rows
args.info: Number of results to return per page. Defaults to 25. Maximum is 50

blocks.name: getCompanyOverallReport
blocks.description: The company report provides statistics about your company performance over a given time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how performance changed between the two ranges.

blocks.name: getCustomersHelpedReport
blocks.description: The customers helped report provides statistics about how many customers were helped over a given time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how the number of customers helped changed between the two ranges.

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day,week,month

blocks.name: getCompanyDrillDownReport
blocks.description: This report is similar to the Company Report, but instead of returning statistics about the company, it drills down and returns the conversation data that makes up the Company Report.

args.name: rows
args.info: Number of results to return per page. Defaults to 25. Maximum is 50

blocks.name: getUserReport
blocks.description: The report provides a snapshot of a user or team activity over a specified time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how activity changed between the two ranges.

args.name: officeHours
args.info: Whether to take office hours into consideration in the report (defaults to 0); office hours must be enabled if 1 is passed, otherwise the default of 0 will be used

args.name: user
args.info: User or team identifier for this report

blocks.name: getUserConversationHistoryReport
blocks.description: The conversation history report provides details about a user's conversations for over a specified time range.

args.name: officeHours
args.info: Whether to take office hours into consideration in the report (defaults to 0); office hours must be enabled if 1 is passed, otherwise the default of 0 will be used

args.name: user
args.info: User or team identifier for this report

args.name: sortField
args.info: Field which to sort results by. Must be: number, repliesSent, responseTime, resolveTime

blocks.name: getUserCustomersHelpedReport
blocks.description: This reports provides the number of customers a user helped for each period in a specified time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how the number of customers helped changed between the two time ranges.

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day,week,month

args.name: user
args.info: User or team identifier for this report

blocks.name: getUserRepliesReport
blocks.description: This reports provides the number of replies a user sent for each period in a specified time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how the number replies changed between the two time ranges.

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day,week,month

args.name: user
args.info: User or team identifier for this report

blocks.name: getUserResolutionsReport
blocks.description: This reports provides the number of conversations a user helped resolve for each period in a specified time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how the number of resolved conversations changed between the two time ranges.

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day,week,month

args.name: user
args.info: User or team identifier for this report

blocks.name: getUserHappinessReport
blocks.description: The happiness report provides information about how many Great, Okay, and Not Good ratings a user received for each period in a specified time range. You may optionally specify two time ranges to see how happiness ratings changed between the two time ranges.

args.name: viewBy
args.info: Resolution at which data is returned. Must be: day,week,month

args.name: user
args.info: User or team identifier for this report

blocks.name: getUserRatingsReport
blocks.description: The user ratings report provides a user's ratings for over a specified time range.

args.name: user
args.info: User or team identifier for this report

args.name: rating
args.info: Which set of ratings to display. Must be: 0 - for all ratings, 1 - for Great ratings, 2 - for Okay ratings, 3 - for Not Good ratings

args.name: sortField
args.info: Field which to sort results by. Must be: number, modifiedAt, rating

blocks.name: searchConversations
blocks.description: Search conversations

args.name: pageSize
args.info: 50 is the default and also the maximum page size

args.name: query
args.info: If no query is specified, all conversations will be returned. Example: (subject:'Learning')

args.name: sortField
args.info: Field which to sort results by. Must be: customerName, mailboxid, modifiedAt, number, score, status, subject

blocks.name: searchCustomers
blocks.description: Search customers.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: 50 is the default and also the maximum page size

args.name: query
args.info: If no query is specified, all conversations will be returned.

args.name: sortField
args.info: Field which to sort results by. Must be: number, modifiedAt, rating

blocks.name: getTagsList
blocks.description: Returns a list of tags used across all mailboxes. Tags are returned in alphabetical order, A-Z.

blocks.name: getTeamsList
blocks.description: Returns a list of teams

blocks.name: getSingleTeam
blocks.description: Returns a single team

blocks.name: getTeamMembers
blocks.description: Returns a team members

blocks.name: getUsersList
blocks.description: Returns a list of users

blocks.name: getSingleUser
blocks.description: Returns a single user

blocks.name: getCurrentUser
blocks.description: Returns a current user

blocks.name: getMailboxUsersList
blocks.description: Returns a mailbox users list

blocks.name: createWebhook
blocks.description: Clients may create and configure up to one webhook per company. A webhook may be configured to receive multiple event notifications (e.g. conversation created, note added). Each request to this API will replace the existing webhook (if any) with the one specified in the request body.

args.name: url
args.info: The callback URL where Help Scout will post your webhook events. This is the script or location where you'll handle the data received from Help Scout.

args.name: events
args.info: The list of events to subscribe to.

args.name: secret
args.info: A randomly-generated (by you) string of 40 characters or less used to create signatures for each webhook method. Help Scout uses this secret key to generate a signature for each webhook message. When the message is received at your callback URL, you can calculate a signature and compare to the one Help Scout sends. If the signatures match, you know it's from Help Scout.

blocks.name: getWorkflowsList
blocks.description: Returns a list of manual workflows that are associated with the specified mailbox. The list is ordered by the workflow order property, in ascending order.

blocks.name: updateWorkflow
blocks.description: Update workflow object. Note: At this time, this endpoint will only update the status of a workflow to either 'active' or 'inactive'. Any other attributes passed will be ignored.

args.name: reload
args.info: Set this request parameter to true to return the workflow in the response.

blocks.name: runWorkflowOnSingleConversation
blocks.description: Applies the actions for the specified manual workflow on the specified conversation. Specifying an automatic workflow will return an error.

blocks.name: runWorkflowOnMultiplyConversation
blocks.description: Applies the actions for the specified manual workflow on each conversation specified in the body of the request. Specifying an automatic workflow will return an error.
